articles.author: ENS Economic Bureau
articles.title: Rupee nears 72 level on panic rush among investors for dollars
articles.description: Dealers said the central bank sold $24 billion during the span when the rupee fell from 65 to the dollar to 69 while it has sold just about $5 billion when it moved from 70 to 72.
articles.content: The RBI then intervened in a mild way and the rupee recouped partially and closed at 71.99 against the dollar. (Representational Image) The rupee on Thursday fell below the 72 mark in intra-day trading for the first time and closed 23 paise down at 71.99 agai… [+3098 chars]

articles.title: Sensex Breaks 6-Day Fall, Nifty Reclaims 11,500
articles.description: Top gainers on the 50-scrip Nifty index included Reliance Industries, Cipla, Coal India, Sun Pharma and Lupin. The Nifty Pharma rose 2.7% led by Aurobindo Pharma, which surged over 9% after the drug maker announced a $900-million acquisition in the US.
articles.content: Stock markets rose on Thursday led by energy, pharma and commodity stocks. BSE benchmark index Sensex gained 224 points to close at 38,242 while the NSE Nifty rose 59 points, to settle at 11,536. Advances in the domestic markets came a day after dropping to n… [+2006 chars]

articles.title: Chutes & Ladders—Sean Harper and Beth Seidenberg unite to run $320M VC fund
articles.description: Sean Harper and Beth Seidenberg unite to run $320M VC fund; Agios crowns Jackie Fouse as CEO; Hospital-backed Civica Rx nabs Amgen veteran as CEO; and Lilly hands oncology baton to R&D executive Anne White. Those moves plus more hirings, firings and retirings…

articles.description: The Nifty Realty index was trading 0.40 per cent up at 266 around 02:20 pm on Thursday.

articles.title: Sensex ramps up more than 200 points, Nifty closes above 10,500
articles.description: 30-share BSE Sensex ​​gained 224.50 points to close at 38,242.81 while the broader 50-share NSE Nifty finished trading at 11,536.90, up 59.95 points. Both the indices gained more than half a per cent. ​The markets had opened on a volatile note in the morning.
articles.content: NEW DELHI: Equity markets on Thursday opened in the green after six successive days of losses, as pharma and finance sector stocks firmed up 30-share BSE Sensex gained 224.50 points to close at 38,242.81 while the broader 50-share NSE Nifty finished trading a… [+536 chars]
